Class TemplateTSP

java.lang.Object
com.pld.agile.model.algorithm.tsp.TemplateTSP
All Implemented Interfaces:
TSP
Direct Known Subclasses:
TSP1
public abstract class TemplateTSP extends Object implements TSP
The TemplateTSP class provides an abstract template for solving the Traveling Salesman Problem (TSP) using a branch and bound algorithm. Subclasses of TemplateTSP must define specific methods for calculating lower bounds and determining the traversal order of vertices.

  • Method Details

    • searchSolution

      public void searchSolution(int timeLimit, Graph g)
      Starts the search for the best solution to the TSP using a branch and bound algorithm. The method runs within the given time limit and attempts to find the shortest possible route that visits each vertex exactly once and returns to the starting vertex.
      Specified by:
      searchSolution in interface TSP
      Parameters:
      timeLimit - the maximum time allowed for the search (in milliseconds)
      g - the graph representing the TSP problem

    • getSolution

      public Integer getSolution(int i)
      Returns the vertex in the best solution at the given index.
      Specified by:
      getSolution in interface TSP
      Parameters:
      i - the index of the vertex in the best solution
      Returns:
      the vertex at index i, or -1 if no valid solution exists

    • getSolutionCost

      public Double getSolutionCost()
      Returns the cost of the best solution found.
      Specified by:
      getSolutionCost in interface TSP
      Returns:
      the total cost of the best solution, or -1.0 if no solution was found

    • bound

      protected abstract int bound(Integer currentVertex, Collection<Integer> unvisited)
      Method that must be implemented in subclasses of TemplateTSP. Computes a lower bound on the cost of completing the tour from the current vertex through the remaining unvisited vertices and back to the starting vertex.
      Parameters:
      currentVertex - the current vertex
      unvisited - the set of unvisited vertices
      Returns:
      a lower bound on the remaining cost of the tour

    • iterator

      protected abstract Iterator<Integer> iterator(Integer currentVertex, Collection<Integer> unvisited, Graph g)
      Method that must be implemented in subclasses of TemplateTSP. Provides an iterator for traversing the unvisited vertices that are successors of the current vertex in the graph. The iterator determines the order in which these vertices are explored during the branch and bound search.
      Parameters:
      currentVertex - the current vertex
      unvisited - the set of unvisited vertices
      g - the graph representing the problem
      Returns:
      an iterator for the unvisited successors of currentVertex

    • branchAndBound

      private void branchAndBound(int currentVertex, Collection<Integer> unvisited, Collection<Integer> visited, Double currentCost)
      The core branch and bound algorithm for solving the TSP. This method recursively explores possible solutions by branching on unvisited vertices and pruning paths that exceed the current best solution using lower bounds.
      Parameters:
      currentVertex - the last visited vertex
      unvisited - the set of vertices that have not yet been visited
      visited - the sequence of vertices that have already been visited
      currentCost - the current cost of the path corresponding to visited
